attributes.action: The Head of The Commonwealth of Nations should be an elected position.
attributes.background:
A heredity head of The Commonwealth of Nations devalues the institution and the United Kingdom.
All positions of influence should be held on merit.
The office should be held for a single term of fixed length.

rejection.details:
The decision on how the Head of the Commonwealth is chosen is the responsibility for all members of the Commonwealth, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition asking the UK Government to urge other Commonwealth governments to consider making the position an elected one, if that's what you want to happen.
